sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A vindication of the divines of the Church of England who have sworn allegiance to K. William & Q. Mary, from the imputations of apostasy and perjury, which are cast upon them upon that account, in the now publish'd History of passive obedience / by one of those divines. Fowler, Edward, 1632-1714.
15 p.
Printed for Brabazon Aylmer ..., London : 1689.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library. A reply to Abednigo Seller's The history of passive obedience since the Reformation. Attributed to Edward Fowler. cf. NUC pre-1956.
=======

15 p.
Printed for Brabazon Aylmer ..., London : 1689.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library. A reply to Abednigo Seller's The history of passive obedience since the Reformation. Attributed to Edward Fowler. cf. NUC pre-1956.
